name: Lahaina Shores Beach Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We loved the condo 706, it fit our needs for a family get away. The furniture was confortable. Loved the bed. The bonus was the laundry room. This made thing nice when traveling with an infanct.
reviews.title: Loved it!!

likes.liked: — The size of the condo, beach
likes.disliked: — when the workers painted the pool area. the smell was bad!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Tom was very helpful with making our reservations.
reviews.title: Absolutely loved Penthouse 706

likes.liked: — It was beautiful and comfortable and a great location.
likes.disliked: — The beach was not very big although it was steps outside of the condo.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grounds include pool, jacuzzi, BBQ’s. Excellent shopping is available at nearby 505 Front Street Shopping Center, which offers award-winning restaurants, shops, and exciting nightlife.
reviews.title: Bad News for Non-smokers / why do we pay for parking? / young guests
Lahaina Shores Room 624
reviews.text: We would stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: John and Shona Bernal
reviews.title: Perfect location right in the heart of Lahaina

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there in Feb for our 40th anniversary and it was excellent. We were suppose to arrive at 330 pm but due to weather on the flights didnt get there til 11 pm We are SMOKERS ya I know. We had requested a smoking room but did not get one and I told the desk clerk that and he said let me work on it overnight and the next day we had a SMOKING room. Its right in the middle of everything and we walked as parking is a premium in Lahaina. Read several reviews before me and we parked at the 505 (those of u that been there will knw what im talking about) and it was 29 bucks for 6 days hey get over it!! And one said noise we have stayed in Waikiki 4 times and u want noise go over there!! Rooms were nice maids very friendly and will do anything for you (almost) haha Beach is a stones throw away Cant say more trying to book it for 2009 right now but they only go out 330 days so will have to wait til next month.
reviews.title: Excellent choice

likes.liked: — location and friendly people desk knew us by our name when we walked by

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Lahina Shores the week of Jan. 13-19, 2008. We were in a studio unit with an ocean view. The resort has a very nice entrance and impressive lobby. The surrounding neighborhood is a little seedy, though. The resort is located within easy walking distance to Old Town Lahaina where there are many shops and restaurants. The white railed bannisters at each lanai look quaint from a distance, but there's some serious paint peeling going on. Paying extra for parking was annoying; it should be included in the room price. Extra annoying is that the parking garage smelled like a dumpster.
reviews.title: Pretty good stay at Lahaina Shores

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our room (#215) had a beautiful view of the ocean. However, it was located right over the pool and Jacuzzi, so there was a noise problem for anyone who wanted to retire before 10 PM. Even after that hour, the resort's maintenance crew made a racket by dragging the plastic chairs across the cement floor. Before sunrise, the maintenance crew would be out there again, hosing down the area and making more noise.
reviews.title: Fabulous Accomodations - definately go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The furnishings of our room were quite nice and well-maintained, although I found it odd that the floor board trim was missing. Unfortunately, there is no dishwasher in this unit, so my vacation included washing dishes. The first time I left dishes in the sink, planning on washing up at the end of the day, the maid squirted a large amount of dish detergent into each bowl, glass, and mug and left. (One such squirt would have sufficed for a whole sink full of dishes.) It took me forever to rinse away all the bubbles that resulted. The maid blew her tip with that stunt. The maid service was a little hit-and-miss anyway -- mildew on the tub's tile, dirty doorknobs, sticky countertop, etc.
reviews.title: Keep coming back

likes.liked: — Right on the ocean, look out the door and watch the whales playing in the water.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this resort to anyone who didn't mind a place that isn't brand new but still a good value. I would also suggest to anyone that they try for a higher floor to escape the noise, especially over the pool area.
reviews.title: Exceeded our expectations - home away from home!

likes.liked: — Size of room and amenities provided with the unit
likes.disliked: — Lahaina Shores Hotel is somewhat dated although the Penthouse 706 unit is excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lahaina Shores is an older property and it surely shows. It really needs some updating and redecorating. Our ocean view studio was OK. About what you'd expect from a 70's era property. The few looking toward Lanai was absolutely fantastic. We found the staff moderately friendly with a very lovely and extremely helpful lady down at the Expedia desk. Be sure to book your excursions through MK Williams. What a sweetheart! With all that said, it was a great place for our home base on Maui. Numerous restaurants, a Foodland grocery store, many many shops, even several churches are all within walking distance. Lahaina Harbor to pick up one of the excursion boats is even within walking distance. Although it is 1.5 miles down front street, the Old Lahaina Luau is still within walking distance if you are physically able. We had a fabulous time in Lahaina. Glad we stayed there rather than the generic resort areas up in Kaanapali or Kihei.
reviews.title: Very Handy Location
Location is great and that's about it. Unfriendly staff, no room service
reviews.text: We stayed at Lahaina Shores for 2 nights in September. On the phone they were nice when we booked our room, but when we got to the front desk they were pretty unfriendly and didn't seem to care too much about customer service. The rooms are very old and run down. The view, however, is spectacular...if you're going to stay here you must upgrade to an ocean view. Otherwise you'll be facing the parking lot! There's a full kitchen with refrigerator, though we didn't use it. The kitchen and bathroom were old but kept pretty clean and seemed fine. Beds are pretty hard and the bedspread looked old, cheap and not so clean...we threw ours on the floor rather than sleep with it. The location is just off the main drag in Lahaina so that was perfect, as we wanted to be close to town. It's the closest hotel if you want to be within walking distance of the restaurants and shopping. The pool was very nice and clean. There is beach access, but it's not the best beach there...very shallow beach and the water was a little murky.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was our wedding anniversary, so they told us they would give us a complimentary bottle of champagne. When we arrived back from our lovely dinner and sunset sail, a warm bottle of champagne was sitting on the countertop. They couldn't even put it in the fridge 5 feet away, and I had left a NICE tip. They also turned OFF the music I had left on for when we got back! Apparently they don't have room service...not even ice. I actually brought the champagne back to them and said to forget it...not that I'm trying to be ungrateful but I'd rather they hadn't done anything than something that dumb. The front desk guy didn't really care and just grabbed the bottle and said "ok." Oh well!
reviews.title: Great Place For Longer Stay

likes.liked: — Kitchen, large lanais, proximity to beach
likes.disliked: — beach is not swimmable, but the whole area is like that

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: AAA booked our rooms for us, and we did some moving around on the islands, so we didn't stay in many places for more than one night. We were only at Lahaina Shores for one night, but if we were going to stay in that area for more than one night, this would be the place to stay. The beach is right outside, so we could sit out on our lanai and enjoy the view. It was gorgeous! The beach in this area is not swimmable, but it's great for a beach stroll, sunsets, or just sitting on the lanai and hearing the waves. Lanais are a good size and have post railings, so you don't have to crane your neck to see above a concrete wall if you are seated. The kitchen area is fully outfitted, making it a great place for a longer stay. There is a full-sized fridge for anyone who wants to get groceries and save some money by eating in for some meals. There is a pool & a hot tub. We were planning to drive the road to Hana, and we were told at the desk that we could borrow a DVD of the drive if we wanted to learn more about what is on the route. We had a tour book, so this was not necessary, but it's wonderful that they have such things available and take the time to find out if they can help with the rest of your trip in some way. The resort is within walking distance of the town, which is a nice feature, as parking in Lahaina is difficult.
reviews.title: Idyllic stay in Paradise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Lahaina Shores was the answer to a lot of searching for a place to relax and really enjoy Maui. This was our first stay at this grand old colonial hotel, and we made the commitment to return twice a year and made our reservations while we were there. We have stayed in several sites on Maui, but have never had a more beautiful view as we did from our comfortable 4th floor room. The staff were all really friendly and helpful. The underground garage kept our car cool when we took to the road. The proximity to the little town of Lahaina was an easy walk several times a day. Early in the mornings, we walked in the surf, which was a few feet outside the lobby of the hotel. Watching the sun kiss the island of Lanai at sunrise was a special delight. We will return in January and again in June of 2008.
reviews.title: All the comforts of home
Great small hotel
reviews.text: My son and I stayed here last Thanksgiving for the first time. We got a great rate through Travelzoo-$79/nt including tax! It wasn't fancy, but the staff was very friendly, the lobby was nice, the location right in Lahaina was great if you want to do some shopping, dining, etc. I loved laying on the grassy area watching the ships out on the ocean. The rooms were incredibly quiet-we had a "town" view which was fine, though I'm sure an ocean view would be much prettier. We also had a small kitchen-full size appliances, which was great for making breakfast/lunch and saving some money. All in all, a great experience if you're not planning on spending a lot of time in your room. I'd stay there again if I was planning on spending some time in Lahaina town.

reviews.title: My Maui Home
reviews.text: I've stayed at Lahaina Shores 4 times - the first 3 were in studio units booked direct with the property. The 4th time was in January 2004 - a 1 BR 5th floor corner unit booked thru the owner. While I had no major complaints with the studio units, the 1 BR unit was wonderful - 2 lanais, lots of space. Since I sometimes travel to Maui by myself, and I don't drive, Lahaina Shores is a great location for me! It's close enough to all the shops, restaurants, etc. of Front St, but far enough so that you can get away from the busyness of it all at the end of the day. I can walk to Lahaina Harbor to catch the shuttles to the other areas of the island. The staff has always been very friendly - in fact, on my last trip, one of them was leaving as I was going to walk down to the grocery, and she offered me a ride & then insisted she would wait for me & give me a ride back. They always store my luggage for me on my last day, so that I can have a full day in Lahaina before I go off to the airport. Lahaina Shores is defintely not a deluxe property - I've stayed at some of those & still love LS. Because most of the units are privately owned, they are all decorated differently, and I'm sure some of them can use some updating, but this situation is found at a lot of hotels, unless they've just gone thru a major renovation.

reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For.
reviews.text: Selected this hotel due reviews at this website. Out of 5 stars, I give it a generous 2. You have to pay for parking, they encourage you to re-use your bath towels, the beach outside of the hotel is dirty, the staff tries their best to be friendly but can do better, the kiosk desk was built in the 30's. You get what you pay for. If you want something nice, go to Kapalua or Wailea. If you can't afford that, stick with Kaanapali. If you can "tough it out", stay at Lahaina Shores. What worked for us is to only use the hotel to sleep. Wake at 7 am and split.

reviews.title: If you stay here, get an ocean front room 4th floor or higher!!!
reviews.text: I agree with everything that Tripadvisor user from Cypress, CA wrote on June 9th. You can't beat the ocean front rooms (especially on the higher floors) for the price. We stayed in an ocean front on the 5th floor and loved it. No, it's not the Ritz, but it doesn't claim to be. Where else can you fall asleep to the sound of waves crashing right outside your lanai for $150 a night? Lahaina Shores is the place to stay in Maui - everything, including a Foodland grocery store, is within walking distance. There's also a great romantic luau right next door. The Feast at Lele. It's expensive but well worth it!!!

reviews.title: Stay Away!!!!
reviews.text: Sorry guys.. If you are looking for a deal... Look elsewhere. You will be disappointed if you come here. Just arrived here and instead of spoiling our vacation and trying to tough it out here, I just booked a room at the Ritz about 6 miles away and will be spending the rest of our trip there. my fiance was horrified with the wet floor, musty smell (luckily I brought some FreBreeze), outdated dirty bathrooms, and it is just overall crappy... Equivilant to a Motel6... Get real.. It's more like a cheap local nonchain motel that you rent by the hour...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Lahaina Shores from March 28-April 4/07 and we were happy with our stay. When we first checked in they had us on the 2 floor and our view was not that great and we were close to the 505 Front Street (which was a little loud in the evening) - the next morning we asked if there were any rooms available on a higher floor and they moved us too 621 - very nice room - amazing ocean front view
reviews.title: Great Place - Lahaina Shore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - the sunsets were amazing..nothing better than sitting on you lanai have a glass of wine and watching the sunset. The hotel is older but very clean and the staff are wonderful. We would definitely
reviews.title: Bummer

likes.disliked: — poor service, over priced accomodation, stinky parking...ick!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: stay there again..
reviews.title: Great deal--beautiful room!

likes.liked: — large size of condo and cleanliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Terrible service, the staff made you feel like you're an inconvinience to them, no ice machine, 3 bucks to wash your clothes, really over priced, then you have to park to this yucky ugly scary parking below Front Street building..ick!!! The jacuzzi didnt work well.
reviews.title: A fully-depreciated operation...with a great view

likes.disliked: — Old, almost everything there was probably written off 10 years ago

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Few good things, close to everything if you need the beach, its there, you need food..its practically next door, you need to shop, go shop next door, other than that, I DO NOT recommend this hotel but then again if you dont mind the first comment then you're all set.
reviews.title: BEST deal on Maui, hands down!

likes.disliked: — The pool was lacking, and most guests were much older

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Went through condominum rentals hawaii to rent two condos here at Lahaina and we were very pleased with our accomodations. The view we had was excellent. The condo was in good condition. It needed a few updates but everything was in good order. The staff at the front desk was very friendly. And the concierge breakfast was a great way to learn about Maui if you have never been there before. The condo was in an excellent location to town. About a 10 minute walk to town or the harbor where a lot of the excursions take off from. Can't say enough about the location it was really great. I would definetly go back to Lahaina Shores/ a home away from home.
reviews.title: Loved Lahaina Shores

likes.disliked: — condo could have been more updated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hello. Our family stayed in maui for the 4th of july week and stayed at Lahaina Shores because we wanted a condo with a kitchen. We contacted the owners of the condo directly and saved a lot. The place is beatiful. It isn't an ocean view, but the view of the mountains from the lanai is super, great for a morning coffee and sunrise or an afternoon cigar, Make sure you have plenty f film in your camera. The unit is just recently decorated and looks like it came out of a magazine. We wanted to save some money so we shopped at safeway (make sure you go to the customer service counter and get a shopping card to use instantly and save more), which is right up the street at the northern end of lahaina, and we ate dinners in the condo. It has a full kitchen with everything you need. We also packed lunches for the daily snorkeling and sightseeing trips. It was right next to town for shopping and other ventures from the marina (parasiling, snorkeling, deep sea fishing, etc.).
reviews.title: penthouse #6 at Lahaina Shores. AWESOME!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The concierge at Lahain shores was more than helpful in planning our week. The hotel was a little more relaxed than some of the other big places to stay, very clean hotel and friendly people, but it had all the necessities, closness to shopping and fun, outside gas grills, smaller but noncrowded pool, quiet beach, good snorkeling right from shore, etc.
reviews.title: Just What We Were Looking For

likes.liked: — Great value for a very nice condo.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to contact the owner directly he has an e-mail and website;
reviews.title: Great place

likes.disliked: — "beach" was very small...not what I expected in Hawaii

reviews.title: Worked for us
reviews.text: email : lahainacondo@yahoo.com

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2004
reviews.text: We stayed there from 12/17- 12/26/2004 and loved it, and shall come back to this very nice hotel with the great location. We spent 5 nights in the Ocean front room and the rest on the Mountain side. Yes, the Ocean front is very nice and I would take that over the mountain view. The hotel is basic, yet clean and very nice. It has a fun sized pool and is right on the beach. If you get the ocean side you will fall asleep to the sounds of the waves in your ears and by the end of your trip in your heart. It should be noted that this is NOT a Resort per say, and does not compare to the services/rooms offered at the likes of the Four Seasons or any other 5 stars super hotel/true resort. If you need that kind of service you should think about another place to stay and of course pay. However, for the money this place is great. All the rooms come with a small kitchenette which is a nice option for reheating things you may pick up from one of the many great places to eat on the island. The staff is great and let it be known that they are there to help you 24 hours a day. If you book ask for an upper floor room (fifth floor or better) and try to get one that is to the south end of the hotel away from the party/luau that sometimes takes place at a nearby club. ( The party/luau ends at 10 PM so don't worry about being kept up all night) Also the hotel is about a 1/4 mile (15 min walk) from the fun of the beach town called Lahaina which is just the right distance to be. You should however get the rental car. You have parking there at the hotel for 3 dollars a night. I booked a small car via Alamo and was offered a jeep for only 100.00 more at the counter, for a total of 350.00 for 10 days (this would have cost me 650.00 had I booked a jeep on the web) I am told that this, " we have a special" thing being told to you at the counter, is very common. Also don't be scared into doing the Hanna highway with a group tour. Your rental car, yes car will more then be able to make the tip, and you will not be stuck in a van with a bunch of yahoo's The only other must have in Maui is what travel people in the know call the Bible. It is a travel book called Maui Revealed by Andrew Doughty & Harriet Friedman, it is a must have to see all the many things and eat at the greatest local places, and book with the right companies for your many events. And, I am not joking you will see all the people carrying it like some kind of bible. MAUI............Great time.... Great place...... WILL BE BACK!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay
Okay but I wouldn't stay there again.
reviews.text: We got married in Maui and we stayed in the Lahaina area the first 4 days at this hotel and I was so upset my first few day here. We check in and there were dead bugs all over our room. We called done to the front desk to get a new room and they told us we would have to wait until the manager got there the next day. I told them it was my wedding/honeymoon but they didn't care. We had a hard time falling asleep that night and then I woke up to a bug crawling on me. The manager never contacted me I had to contact the manager. They did move us that night and the new room we were moved into was clean but very old looking. The reason why I put Okay instead of Terrible is because I had a friend staying there too and her room was good. It had newer furniture and was clean. So I think it's just the luck of the draw. If you want a cheep place to stay it's okay but DO NOT GO HERE IF IT'S YOUR HONEYMOON OR IF YOU HATE BUGS, YOU WILL BE DISAPOITED!

reviews.title: Great location, great view
reviews.text: Book this hotel as part of a packaged deal and you will get a deal! We got a spacious clean room on the mountain side and what a view! We loved the full kitchen, a must-have in pricey Maui. Location was perfect - right on the outskirts of downtown Lahaina, lots of places that you can stroll to, and yet quiet. Go figure!

reviews.title: Like being in Old Hawaii
reviews.text: My Husband and I were at the Lahaina Shores Resort from Nov. 11-15th. We were pleasantly surprised at how large our rooms were, and we never expected to have 2 bathrooms! The view right outside our room was breathtaking! To get up everymorning and see the plam trees swaying in the breeze with the ocean in the background was something we will remember always. The resort had a feeling of relaxing gentle graciousness----Just what we needed after the hustle and bustle of Oahu. The beds were super comfortable, and the staff was great! Loved the pool and spa too. We hope to stay there again on our next visit to Maui

reviews.title: Very disappointed
reviews.text: For a recent trip to Maui for a family wedding, I researched the Internet for hotels, with an emphasis on those that were well above the norm. From the information I found, the Lahaina Shores Beach Resort met this requirement. However, we found the staff not very friendly or helpful. The distribution of towels and washcloths for our room was chintzy, at best. A requested late checkout was flatly denied. A request to repair a slow draining sink and tub was never done. Their attitude was that they were doing us a favor by allowing us to stay at their property, rather than being appreciative of our business. We had a decent mountain view in the distance, but right across the street looked like poverty-city. Our room was below average with furnishings being old and outdated and no food service on the property at all. Both the room and the hotel, in general are past due for major updating. The property did not closely resemble the pictures we found on the Internet. Overall, we were very disappointed and unimpressed with this hotel and would probably not stay there again nor recommend it to anyone. We give it 2 stars on a good day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2004
reviews.text: We stayed at the Lahaina shores in October and had a wonderful time. Lahaina shores is not a huge resort with all the thrills but it is a wonderful place to stay. It is were all the action is. After talking to many other visitors at Luaus and other activities they were dissapointed in the distance they had to travel to get any where. So be aware of your location if you plan on alot of activites. If you stay at the shores besure you ask for a Ocean Front room and something on the 4th floor or above. I could see where people would not like the ground floor or a mountain view. From our Lanai each morning we had magnificant sunsets and sunrises. Next to the hotel was a night luau but that ended by 8:30-9:00 so it never interfered with sleep as reported in some reviews. The staff was very helpful and went out of they way to help you. It was great having a full kitchen so you could cook if you wanted or heat something up. You were within walking distance of many activities, during the day or night. Our bed was a wall unit that recessed into the wall during the day so we had alot of space. Each unit is decorated differently as these are peoples condo that they rent out during the year. Don't be afraid to try it out. If we return to hawaii I wouldn't think of staying any place else.
reviews.title: What a great place for the $$
Awesome
reviews.text: Just got home 2 weeks ago. Stayed in a 1-bedroom ocean front (bottom floor). Can't wait to go back. Husband wants to leave tomorrow. Management was great, room was excellent. Pay the extra money for the 1-bedroom, you won't be disappointed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2004
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for a week at the Lahaina Shores in June 2004 -- this is our third stay at this resort, and it is the only place I know that is as wonderful as I remembered it each time I return!
reviews.title: Our part of paradise
Lahaina Shores -- Right Resort...Wrong Person
reviews.text: Lahaina Shores is not only a short stroll to the beach, but also "stumbling distance" to Hecock's Bar and Italian Restaurant right next door. If you have money to burn, The Feast at Lele is a great luau to go to, or you can watch the dancers and musicians for free from Hecock's open windows each night.

reviews.title: Check it out first.
reviews.text: Whether you want solitude or romance, you can find both at Lahaina Shores. We slept with the window open listening to the waves all night, then I woke up early and read on the balcony overlooking the ocean while my husband slept in (his idea of fun and excitement).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is located on Front Street, which is the main drag in Lahaina. Lots of restaurants and shops are along Front, as well as lots of historical sites. It is on the south end of town, but the walk isn't bad. It is also located right next to 505 Front, which has many great restaurants, including I'O, Pacific O, and Gaby's (they have great pizza!), so that is convenient.
reviews.title: Our Honeymoon Home Base

likes.disliked: — Grounds were not that great. Probably only 5' beach with ho-hum pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lahaina is an old town, so many of the accomodations are also older. Lahaina Shores was clean, but it wasn't anything special. It was a little dark, but I'm not all that picky. The pool was fine, though we didn't get in. It is on the beach, but you wouldn't really want to hang out there. There is a nice grassy area between the complex and the beach. If you want a nice beach without being on some of the main touristy strips like Ka'anapali, then look for something on Kahana beach. If we were to stay in Lahaina again, we would go with a place off the beach that is a little more historical. That's really what Lahaina is all about -- the history. There are some nice B&Bs and other types of accomodations that I've heard are wonderful.
reviews.title: Great Time, Great Location and Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you don't plan to spend much time in the condo, then the price of this one is pretty good for what you are getting. We didn't get in our car the entire time we were there because everything is so close.
reviews.title: Ocean view room a must....
Aloha Spirit
reviews.text: Only someone not living the aloha spirit would give the LSH less than 5 stars. My wife and I just spent two weeks there for our honeymoon and it was a dream. If you were born with a silver spoon in your mouth and are referred to by others as snobs, then this place is not for you. As a matter of fact Hawai'i and esp Maui is not for you, so do them a favor and stay away, you would be breaking the Aloha Spirit Law (look it up!). Aloha & Mahalo!

reviews.title: Just an OK hotel...
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I booked our entire Maui trip through a travel agent and picked the Lahaina Shores Hotel due to how close the cute shops were, plus the fact that the hotel offered kitchens. They generously upgraded us to the "penthouse", which was twice the size of the regular rooms... I read a bunch of reviews before going and was somewhat apprehensive to stay there because of things I read. When we got there, the reviews were true... the place is quite run down but nothing TOO bad. The rooms seem clean enough (although a little bit of corner cleaning needs to be done) so I did not feel like I needed to leave. One thing I do need to point out is that one night we got back to the hotel pretty late and went out to the patio. It was FILLED with HUGE cockroaches. I almost had a heart attack. I called the front desk to make them aware and was told "Welcome to the mainland." Whatever that means... perhaps cockroaches run rampid in Maui??? I do not know, but we were forced to keep our doors shut once the sun went down which was a huge bummer. The customer service that was previously raved about by other reviewers was not something we witnessed. They were cordial, but not going out of their way to make sure our stay was pleasant. I probably would not stay again due to the cockroach issue, but if you don't mind keeping the doors closed from dusk until dawn, it was an OK place to stay. (BTW: we were on the 7th floor and they climbed up that far... I'm somewhat of a neat freak and know that they were not after anything we had in the room!!) One more thing... there is no beach in front of the hotel. None. You have to travel to Kapalua to experience the greatness of the Maui beaches. (D.T. Fleming beach is AWESOME.)

reviews.title: Great Budget Hotel
reviews.text: I stayed at Lahaina Shores from Aug 11 thru the 16 and it's a great hotel for people that don't spend much time in their rooms except to sleep. If hotel decor is important to you, don't stay here. You can see that the rooms and building are a little run down and outdated. Overall it's a good place to stay and I would stay here again in the future. PS. I had a mountain view studio and the full size fridge came in handy for freezing large bottles of water.

reviews.title: AWESOME!!!
reviews.text: We stayed @ Lahaina Shores in mid July 2004. We were pleasantly surprised with our room. We had a oceanfront studio on the 5th floor. It really was OCEANFRONT! The minute we opened the door to our room, we could see the blue ocean water and palm trees swaying outside the balcony. At night we went to sleep to the sound of the waves washing up onto the sand right outside our room. I don't think any of the fancier resorts in Kaanapali offer oceanfront rooms this close to the water! Our room was larger than expected considering it was a studio. We also had a full kitchen and a spacious closet. We loved it!!! Also, we found the hotel staff very friendly and service was great. We also liked the fact that this hotel was located close enough to Lahaina village so that you could walk there (as we often did) but tucked away enough so that you weren't bothered by noise and traffic. Location was great! We enjoyed our stay immensely and would stay here again!!!

reviews.title: We love it!!!!
reviews.text: We've been to Maui seven times so far and since discovering the Lahaina Shores have stayed there every time we go back. It's lovely, affordable and convenient to shopping, restaurants and Lahaina harbor. You could even get by without renting a car.

description: Welcome to oceanfront living right in the heart of Lahaina Town. Lahaina Shores Beach Resort is a landmark in historic Lahaina town. This ocean front condo resort features spacious studio, one bedroom and one bedroom penthouse condos with full kitchens and oversized lanais.
